items.text: full on off stump, drives back at the bowler
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.preText: This might be where the game's been won: Bangladesh against spin - Seven fours and two sixes; West Indies - three fours and no sixes
items.text: full from round the wicket, perhaps looking for a yorker. Mushfiqur defends well
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: nearly a return catch as the left-arm round angle helps him angle the ball into the right-hander, his own skill helps it straighten. Mushfiqur is committed to the flick and is startled as a top edge goes back towards Reifer. Falls short eventually
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: shortish and outside off, he punches to point
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: full on off stump, he drives to mid-off
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: slower ball this time, pitching on a good length on off stump, Mushfiqur defends well
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: goes for the on the up drive and places it to the left of the sweeper. Good stuff
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, 2 runs

items.preText: Trihan: "Thoughts on the WC, if Soumya can carry on his form and be consistent, Bangladesh can put up a great show in the mega event. Since Tamim usually plays the anchor these days, he can play through and build the innings while Soumya scores the runs at a good rate. "
items.text: oooh, that's lovely. More evidence that the slower balls are getting a lot of purchace on this pitch. This one straightens against the angle and might be kicking up at the right-hander too. Mithun is way too early into his block and is beaten on the outside edge, the ball flicking his pocket through to the keeper
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: taps to backward point, doing better to ride the bounce
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full on middle and leg, tucks it to midwicket
items.postText: Arjun: "Fabian Allen has 27 first class wickets in 41 outings across the three formats including just one 4 wicket haul. Has not taken a single wicket in 5 ODls and done nothing with the bat either. Wonder why they keep an apparently blind faith in his abilities!"
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: takes the pace off again and its because of that that the cut shot goes straight to point
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: full on off stump, defends
items.postText: AnamBMDF : "Being a citizen of BD, the success of cricket team makes me proud a lot. But the reality in English condition for BD like nonscoring 330+ regularly, nonexistence of batters like Buttler, Russel etc, overdependence on spinners, being puzzled for pressure in Asian level finals etc. don't make me believe for success more in BD team than WI. But I won't be surprised if Almighty makes us happy in WC like it was in Champions Trophy. Best of luck, dears...."
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: shortish and on off stump, defends with an open face
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: dropped... essentially because Roach misjudges a simple catch at deep square leg. He comes forward as Mithun pulls the ball, underestimating the power on the shot. had he stayed on the boundary, it would've been a dolly. Could've been a maiden ODI wicket for Reifer. And a game-breaking one at that
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, FOUR runs

items.text: fuller delivery, and slower too, on off stump. Defends
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, no run

items.text: slices a back of a length delivery outside off to third man
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: another slower ball, hitting a good length and getting it to straighten against the angle round the wicket. Mushfiqur does well to play late and block it behind point
items.shortText: Reifer to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: gets up nice and tall to deal with a bouncer on middle, pulling it through midwicket
items.shortText: Reifer to Mohammad Mithun, 2 runs

items.text: good length on off stump, defends
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, no run

items.text: steps down the track and lifts it over midwicket. Oustanding shot. Impeccable connection. It's actually out of the ground
items.postText:
Time for a new ball then

Imam: "Trihan, it is the bowling that will cost BD I suspect. The only bowler who is a wicket taking threat on flat tracks is Rubel, who will probably not be picked in opening games. Mash and Shakib can controll the run flow while it will probably be Mustafiz and Mehidy that the opposition will target to take on. And they don't have any good part-timer (Mahmudullah won't bowl.) " ---- Never underestimate the Bangladesh spinners
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, SIX runs

items.text: opens the face and guides it down to third man
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: uppish, as the attempted square drive skews off the outside edge and flies away behind point.
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run

items.text: dinks a shortish delivery on leg stump behind square leg
items.shortText: Holder to Mushfiqur Rahim, 1 run

items.text: clips a length ball on leg stump to long leg
items.postText: Peter Azille, S: "The comment related to Blind Faith in Fabian Allen is well put. Kavem Hodge of the Windward, Cornwall from the Leewards and Rutherford of Guyana are all better options...much better options. Their respective records, past and current reflect that. "
items.shortText: Holder to Mohammad Mithun, 1 run
